item.title: Ticket #1501 (Semantics - add ids to edit post screen time modification ui) created
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
from birnamdesigns - ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/38724

The "touch_time" function in "wp-admin/admin-functions.php" needs a small improvement in the HTML syntax. The input tags (such as "jj", "hh", etc.) that receive input for altering the timestamp have "name" attributes, but are lacking "id" attributes.

Adding "id" attributes would allow for javascript retrieval of these fields with "getElementById" instead of the less-reliable "getElementByName".

item.title: Ticket #1500 (Incorrect Feeds using index.php?feed=rss2 - correct only display using ...) created
item.dc:creator: Cicloid
item.description:
The feeds displayed using the index feed option, are incorrect (rss,rss2,rdf,atom) only correct ones are displayed when using the direct files.

You can see the problem in:

​http://idealabs.tk/index.php?feed=rss2 ​http://idealabs.tk/wp-rss2.php

I solve this issue temporary with some custom mod_rewrite rules

Using latest stable (1.5.1.3)

item.title: Changeset [2702]: Massive user_level fix. We were still using the user_level field in ...
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Massive user_level fix. We were still using the user_level field in wp_users in some places, where we should just use the table prefixed usermeta value.

item.title: functions.php.diff attached to Ticket #1499
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description: Patch to functions.php to improve add_option

item.title: Ticket #1499 (add_option shouldn't always check db for pre-existing option) created
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Currently some plugins do the following everytime they are run: 

add_option('my_opt',...);
get_option('my_opt',...);

When these options are defined with autoload as yes wordpress automatically loads them at startup - the add_option code should check the cache to see if the option already exists before checking the db to save on queries.

Patch attached to do this cache checking.

item.title: Ticket #1498 (Using double quotes around strings in a query breaks in mysql in ansi mode) created
item.dc:creator: auroraeosrose
item.description:
from the mysql manual

If the server SQL mode has ANSI_QUOTES enabled, string literals can be quoted only with single quotes. A string quoted with double quotes is interpreted as an identifier.

classes.php has a couple lines where double quotes are used instead of single, the patch below fixed them 

Index: classes.php
===================================================================
--- classes.php	(revision 2700)
+++ classes.php	(working copy)
@@ -498,11 +498,11 @@
 		}
 		if ($this->is_page) {
-			$where .= ' AND (post_status = "static")';
+			$where .= " AND (post_status = 'static')";
 		} elseif ($this->is_single) {
-			$where .= ' AND (post_status != "static")';
+			$where .= " AND (post_status != 'static')";
 		} else {
-			$where .= ' AND (post_status = "publish"';
+			$where .= " AND (post_status = 'publish'";
 			if (isset($user_ID) && ('' != intval($user_ID)))
 				$where .= " OR post_author = $user_ID AND post_status != 'draft' AND post_status != 'static')";

item.title: Ticket #1496 (wp-settings.php should dl() mysql.so if it's not loaded as an extension) updated
item.dc:creator: auroraeosrose
item.description:
oh please don't do it that way, you'll royally screw windows users - the proper way is this (straight from the manual)

if (!extension_loaded('mysql')) {

$prefix = (PHP_SHLIB_SUFFIX == 'dll') ? 'php_' : ; @dl($prefix . 'mysql.' . PHP_SHLIB_SUFFIX); }

you HAVE to error suppress the dl because there's no way to easily tell if a server is TS (thread safe) and dl will spit out a warning if it is - can I get someone to fix the diff? I'm too lazy

item.title: Ticket #1497 (Posts with external editor not checked for duplicate post_name) updated
item.dc:creator: papascott

item.title: Ticket #1497 (Posts with external editor not checked for duplicate post_name) created
item.dc:creator: papascott
item.description:
Posting with MarsEdit with the title "Job Security" produced the slug "job-security", even though a previous post has the same slug.

Editing the post in the browser then changed the slug to "job-security-2", even though the post had long been published.

item.title: Ticket #1496 (wp-settings.php should dl() mysql.so if it's not loaded as an extension) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
People on debian and ubuntu are having problems with WordPress not picking up PHP's mySQL extension, because the extension_loaded('mysql') test is failing. However, this problem can be solved by dynamically loading the mySQL shared object file at runtime, using ​dl().

Patch: 

--- wp-settings.php	2005-07-06 11:04:36.000000000 +0100
+++ wp-settings-new.php	2005-07-08 10:54:46.961662984 +0100
@@ -17,7 +17,8 @@
 	die( 'Your server is running PHP version ' . phpversion() . ' but WordPress requires at least 4.1' );
 if ( !extension_loaded('mysql') )
-	die( 'Your PHP installation appears to be missing the MySQL which is required for WordPress.' );
+	if ( !dl('mysql.so') )
+		die( 'Your PHP installation appears to be missing the MySQL which is required for WordPress.' );
 function timer_start() {
 	global $timestart;

See Also:

​http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-hackers/2005-April/000821.html ​http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=312721

item.title: Ticket #923 (no bulk delete option in link manager) updated
item.dc:creator: tivac
item.description: Added a new submit button on the bottom: "Delete Selected". Pops up javascript confirmation box very similar to individual delete, then deletes all selcted links.
